business.headline: Will AI kill jobs across the globe and how can India ride the AI wave? Experts weigh inIn this India Today special show from the World Economic Forum in Davos, top artificial intelligence innovators share their perspectives on the global AI race, AI's impact on the Indian economy and much more.

From income protection to easier credit: What gig workers expect from Budget 2026Delivery partners, drivers and freelancers form the backbone of India's fast-growing gig economy, yet financial security remains fragile for many. As Budget 2026 approaches, gig workers are hoping for measures that offer income protection, smoother credit access and faster support during emergencies.

Gold shines at record highs: What should investors do now?With gold touching new lifetime highs, the metal has once again proved its role as a refuge in uncertain times. But for investors, the rally raises a key question: what is the right move at current levels? Let's have a look.

Are personal loans becoming the go-to option during medical emergencies?A sudden medical emergency can quickly turn into a financial crisis. With healthcare costs rising and insurance cover often falling short, many Indian families are increasingly turning to personal loans to bridge the gap.

Sensex sinks 770 points, Nifty tumbles as FII selling hits sentiment hardMarkets slipped sharply as foreign investor selling, sector-wide pressure and a weakening rupee crushed sentiment. With Nifty near a key support zone, the next few sessions could set the tone for February.

Sensex down nearly 800 points at closing: Why stock market fell todayAt the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 769.67 points at 81,537.70 and the NSE Nifty50 slipped 241.25 points to 25,048.65.

Sebi accuses PwC and EY executives in Yes Bank's 2022 share sale: ReportIn total, 19 individuals have been accused of insider trading violations. Seven are alleged to have traded using privileged information, while four are accused of sharing it.

Can Budget 2026 help make insurance more affordable for Indians?With healthcare costs rising and insurance still out of reach for many, Budget 2026 is being closely watched by households and insurers alike. Industry leaders believe the right tax and policy moves could make insurance more affordable for millions.

From easier credit to insurance: What MSMEs want from Union Budget 2026As the Union Budget 2026 approaches, MSMEs are looking for practical support to ease everyday financial pressures. Industry leaders say better access to credit, lower insurance costs and simpler rules could help small businesses grow with confidence.

Gold and silver hit new highs again. Should you still buy?While the domestic trend remains sharply bullish, experts say understanding the broader backdrop can help investors think about why the rally is persisting and what it could mean for portfolios this year.

Infosys to hire 20,000 graduates in FY27 as AI demand surges: ReportInfosys is gearing up for heavier AI workloads in 2026 and beyond, and the scale of its campus hiring shows where the company believes client spending is beginning to stabilise and grow.

8th Pay Commission: Employee bodies to meet soon to finalise salary hike demandsThe meeting will be held under the banner of the National Council (Staff Side) of the Joint Consultative Machinery, which represents central government employees in discussions with the government.

Trump sues JPMorgan Chase, CEO Jamie Dimon for $5bn over alleged debankingDonald Trump has filed a $5 billion lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase for closing his bank accounts. The case raises questions about political bias and banking practices in the US.

entertainment.headline: Chris Pratt said he photoshopped himself as Batman, recalls James Gunn's reaction Chris Pratt revealed he pitched a great vision to Kevin Feige for Star-Lord's return to the MCU. He also recalled James Gunn's reaction after he photoshopped his Batman pitch.

The film was officially announced with a title poster launch and puja ceremony.

Baby Girl review: Nivin Pauly's film has promising core, but convenience takes overRelease Date:Fri Jan 23, 2026 Baby Girl movie review: Baby Girl, directed by Arun Varma and starring Nivin Pauly, Lijomil Jose, Sangeeth Prathap, and Abhimanyu Shammi Thilakan, is an emotional thriller about the kidnapping of a three-day-old baby. The film struggles to balance drama and thriller elements, ultimately failing to do justice to either genre.

Palaash Muchhal rejects Rs 40 lakh fraud allegation, vows to take legal action Palaash Muchhal reacted to the Rs 40 lakh fraud allegations and alleged that it had been made with malicious intent. He said that the matter will be dealt with strictly through the appropriate legal channels.

The Legends: Rajdeep Sardesai's new show explores lives that shaped India This Republic Day, India Today will launch The Legends: Lives That Shaped A Nation, featuring Rajdeep Sardesai in conversation with India's biggest living legends. Border 2 ft. 'Dharmendra ji ka beta': Sunny Deol's enduring tribute to late father Sunny Deol refers to himself as "Dharmendra ji ka beta" in the opening credits of Border 2. This is the actor's first release after the death of his father last year.

general news.headline: US notes Bangladesh's Islamist turn, looks to woo Jamaat. DC-Delhi ties at risk?The US might be looking to woo Bangladesh's Islamist party, Jamaat-e-Islami, reports The Washington Post, going by an American diplomat's interaction in Dhaka. Jamaat, which has a pro-Pakistan tilt, is likely to show a strong performance in the February polls. Drawing the Jamaat close might hurt DC's ties with New Delhi, warn experts.

If Tamil was the primordial pulse of the peninsula — forging its identity in earthy Sangam poetry — Sanskrit brought the Vedas, new grammar, and fresh philosophy.

Executing a detailed plan, Netaji boarded the Kalka Mail, which is India's oldest express train and would soon complete 160 years.

Players not consulted in Bangladesh's T20 World Cup boycott: Report The Bangladesh players weren't consulted before the decision was made to boycott the T20 World Cup 2026, according to a latest report. Bangladesh is all set to be replaced by Scotland from the T20 World Cup 2026.

Abhishek has made a stunning start to his T20I career for India and is the No. 1-ranked T20I batter in the world.

Is Toxic Air Threatening India's 2036 Olympic Ambitions? In this special report, Sonal Mehrotra Kapoor examines the escalating pollution crisis in North India and its detrimental impact on the nation's sporting aspirations. Kapoor highlights that the 'air emergency choking North India and several other parts of the country isn't just a health hazard anymore, it's a national liability.' The programme discusses how toxic air quality is jeopardising India's bid for the 2036 Olympics, with Ahmedabad as the frontrunner. Joined by colleague Nikhil Naz, the discussion covers instances where international athletes, including badminton star Anders Antonsen, have raised alarms or refused to play in Delhi. The report further details how pollution affects athlete training, lung capacity, and the overall feasibility of hosting global events like the Commonwealth Games and the ODI World Cup. Kapoor concludes that the environmental crisis is not only an economic burden but a significant hurdle to India's dream of becoming a global sporting powerhouse.

Australian stars' heated verbal tussle in Big Bash League knockouts goes viral: Watch Big Bash League: A heated exchange between Beau Webster and Matthew Wade lit up the Hurricanes dugout during the BBL Challenger, before the Sydney Sixers powered into yet another final with a dominant 57-run victory.

T20 World Cup: New Zealand replace injured Adam Milne with India tormentorNew Zealand have replaced injured fast bowler Adam Milne with Kyle Jamieson for the T20 World Cup 2026. Aston Villa boss Unai Emery shoves Youri Tielemans in heated Europa League momentUnai Emery cut a furious figure during Aston Villa's Europa League win over Fenerbahce. The Villa boss was seen shoving Youri Tielemans during a tense late substitution.

Bangladesh cricket in crisis: What next after T20 World Cup boycott?Bangladesh have maintained their stance on not playing the T20 World Cup in India due to security concerns, but a withdrawal could bring serious complications.

Bangladesh Boycotts T20 World Cup In India Over Security Concerns; Scotland To Join TournamentThis special report details the unprecedented decision by the Bangladesh interim government to boycott the T20 World Cup in India. The speaker notes, 'Bangladesh has clearly chosen politics over cricket at this point of time, boycotting the T20 World Cup despite the ICC security assurances.' The fallout of this decision is immediate, with Scotland set to replace Bangladesh as the highest-ranked non-qualified team. The report highlights that the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) lost an ICC board vote 14-2 regarding a venue change, with only Pakistan supporting them. Tensions reportedly escalated after the BCCI requested Kolkata Knight Riders to release Mustafizur Rahman. Despite the ICC providing security guarantees, the interim government cited 'genuine security risks' and a preference for the tournament to be moved to Sri Lanka. This marks the first time a team has boycotted an entire ICC tournament, leaving the future of Bangladesh cricket in a precarious position as the global tournament faces significant controversy.

Cunning? Pakistan stoke controversy in U19 World Cup with slow chase vs ZimbabweU19 World Cup 2026: Pakistan deliberately slowed their run chase against Zimbabwe in their final league match on Thursday, January 22. The outcome improved their net run rate for the Super Six stage and ended Scotland's qualification hopes, raising questions over fair play.

You'll never walk alone: Liverpool fans back Ibrahima Konate after father's passingLiverpool fans rallied around Ibrahima Konate after the defender confirmed his father's passing. Konate's absence from the Champions League clash against Marseille was later explained as he dealt with the personal loss.

As India settle into their combination, this could turn out to be a golden chance for the batter to fix his place in the playing XI.

More than a finisher, is Rinku final piece of India's puzzle for T20 World Cup?Often considered as a finisher in the Indian team, Rinku Singh offers more luxury to the team management to use him as the perfect utility man in the batting order. With a strong game sense and appetite for runs, Rinku may end up being the final piece in India's batting order.
